alert.note: Alert for Knox (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 6:09PM CDT until March 31 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR KNOX COUNTY... At 609 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Reynolds to near Burgess to near Monmouth, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Rio around 620 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Galesburg, Knoxville, Wataga, Oneida, Altona and Victoria. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 34 and 68. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, north central and west central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
